p: Species belonging to the Apiaceae family such as cumin, coriander, carrot, celery, and parsley are considered foods or spices; however, some of them contain highly toxic substances [ 13]. Niphogeton dissecta is a native herb of the Ecuadorian Andes found at 2500–4500 m above sea level [ 14], and is widely distributed in the provinces of Loja, Azuay, Cañar, Carchi, Chimborazo, Cotopaxi, Morona Santiago, Napo, Pichincha, and Zamora-Chinchipe. Traditionally, it is believed to have medicinal properties and it is used for the treatment of diarrhea, vomiting, inflammation of the belly, colds, and rheumatism [ 15].
